content: realize when you are finished that the piece isn t long enough since you ll have to undo a lot of your work to string on more factor in the bit of length that a closure and the sl sts will add even though they will be very tight and tiny stitches sl sts will add a bit of length it s the reason why the the perlina beaded bracelet copyright © june 2022 2 strand in the photo has 17 sets i worked up to 13 sets in construction step 1 draped it on my wrist and decided 13 sets were enough i left the extra beads alone and returned them to the stash later once you have the beads strung cut this beaded strand from the skein leaving a 7-8 tail on both ends make a slip knot at both ends of this beaded yarn relatively close to the first and last beads but not snug this helps to secure them from slipping away and keeps them close by and ready for your sl sts to hold them in place final strand of beads there are 17 sets in the photo but i stopped at 13 sets too many beads is better than not enough - you don t have to use all of them set the strand of beads aside for a moment with your working yarn from your skein leave a 5-6 tail and make a slip knot insert your hook into this slip knot so that now you are ready to begin crocheting base construction step 1 hold the beginning of the strand of beads together with your working yarn from your skein with your working yarn make a slip_stitch around the bead strand between the slip knot and first bead the bead will slide so don t worry about the placement of your slip_stitch being too far away from the bead just make sure the slip_stitch is the first thing on the bead strand after the slip knot then you can slide the set of beads snug to the slip_stitch the very first slip_stitch between the first slip knot and the first bead of the strand of beads working yarn first slip_stitch bead strand first slip knot on bead strand the perlina beaded bracelet copyright © june 2022 3 base construction step 2 chain 3 then slide the first bead or set of beads up to your hook and make a slip_stitch around the yarn strand after the third bead enclosing the three beads within the chain 3 with a slip_stitch on both sides make sure the entire slip_stitch is on the other side of the first and third bead this may take some wrangling to hold everything in the right place keep at it and you ll develop a technique tip this is somewhat forgiving in that the slip stitches allow for the bead strand yarn to slide don t worry if your slip_stitch isn t snug to the first or third bead
